questions.question_text: The security department will audit an IT department to ensure that the proper guidelines are being followed. The reports of the call detail records show unauthorized access to PSTN. Which two actions should an administrator check to prevent the unauthorized use of the telephony system? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: CD
A is not right, FAC does not recognize an extension, it asks for a code to enter

Provide segmentation and control to the number that can be called, or vice versa. As a leading practice recommendation, either disable Call Forward All or limit it to an extension within your Collaboration network. Call Forward Busy and Call Forward No Answer should also be limited to internal partitions only. For phones with extension mobility, a logged-out CSS should be restricted to internal and emergency partitions only.

https://www.ciscopress.com/articles/article.asp?p=2218297&seqNum=10

choices.D: For extension mobility, logged-out CSS is restricted to internal extensions and emergencies.
choices.E: Add an additional firewall between the Cisco UCM server and the Expressway Core server.
choices.A: Forced authorization code is used to recognize a dialing extension and authorize an international call.
choices.C: Call forward settings (All/Busy/No Answer) are restricted to internal extensions in the network.
choices.B: Ensure that ad hoc conference calls are dropped if an external user is added.

discussion.content: Control Hub enables you to provision, administer, and manage Webex services and Webex Hybrid Services, such as Hybrid Call Service, Hybrid Calendar Service, Hybrid Directory Service, and Video Mesh. https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/products/collateral/conferencing/webex-control-hub/datasheet-c78-740770.html

I think A
The advantage of using Cisco Webex Control Hub is:

A. Offers easy contact management, centralized administration, and centralized configuration management. Cisco Webex Control Hub provides a centralized platform for managing and administering Webex services. It allows administrators to easily manage user accounts, configure settings, and control access to various features and services. With centralized administration and configuration management, organizations can efficiently manage their Webex environment, ensuring consistency and ease of use for users.

In addition to contact management and centralized administration, Cisco Webex Control Hub also offers other benefits such as analytics and reporting, security and compliance features, and integration with other Cisco collaboration tools. However, the specific advantage mentioned in the option is the easy contact management, centralized administration, and centralized configuration management provided by Cisco Webex Control Hub.

questions.question_text: What is an advantage of using Cisco Webex Control Hub?

choices.C: brings video, audio, and web communication together to meet the collaboration needs of the modern workplace
choices.D: enables the provisioning, administration, and management of Webex services and Webex Hybrid Services
choices.B: provides streamlined communication and collaboration for a hybrid workforce
choices.A: offers easy contact management, centralized administration, and centralized configuration management

questions.question_text: A customer reports that the load balancing solution is not working for two Cisco Unified Border Element routers. The (cube1.abc.com) router should take 60% of the calls, and the (cube2.abc.com) router should take 40% of the calls. Assuming all DNS A records are present, which two SRV configurations would provide the desired outcome? (Choose two.)

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: BE
B and E seem correct. Both records should have the same priority, so the weight determines the load division, B has 40 for cube2 and E has 60 for cube1

Selected Answer: A
Policing mechanisms include Class-Based Policing and Committed Access Rate (CAR). Traffic policing mechanisms such as Class-based policing or Committed Access Rate (CAR) also have marking capabilities in addition to rate-limiting capabilities. Instead of dropping the excess traffic, traffic policing can alternatively mark and then send the excess traffic. This allows the excess traffic to be re-marked with a lower priority before the excess traffic is sent out. Traffic shapers, on the other hand, do not re-mark traffic; these only delay excess traffic bursts to conform to a specified rate.

The correct answer to the question "CAR is an example of which technique?" is A. traffic policing.

This is because CAR (Committed Access Rate) is a traffic policing tool used to limit the input or output transmission rate on an interface based on certain criteria, as mentioned in your document on page 318 under the section on Policing:

"Policing tools include class-based policing and committed access rate (CAR). CAR services limit the input or output transmission rate on an interface or subinterface based on a flexible set of criteria

Selected Answer: A
By Definition:
"Committed access rate (CAR) is a metric used Internet quality of service (QoS) agreements to classify and limit customer traffic"

So it is used to "Limit" traffic

Selected Answer: A
First line "This document clarifies the differences between committed access rate (CAR), which is the Cisco legacy traffic policing feature, and class-based policing, which is the newer Cisco traffic policer."

https://www.cisco.com/c/en/us/support/docs/quality-of-service-qos/qos-policing/10118-cbpcar.html

questions.question_text: CAR is an example of which technique?
What is the function of DiffServ?

discussion.content:
Selected Answer: C
There are trick with the words. For example in A, what is "to identify trafic" or in C. what is "to categorize traffic?". sot in some times and contexts, both concepts could be similar.
However, when we talk about something do any task automatically, there must be an algorithm to do that task continuously. In this sense, DiffServ is not an algorithm that deploy a task, rather it is a model. In this sense, I discard A, and I choose C.

The function of DiffServ is discussed in your PDF file on page 317. It operates by categorizing traffic into different classes that require specific Quality of Service (QoS) treatment, which is why the correct answer is:

C. It categorizes traffic.

Here is the relevant excerpt from the document:

"DiffServ model: This model operates on classes that require special QoS treatment. QoS components used in the DiffServ model include classification, marking, congestion management, congestion avoidance, policing and shaping, and link efficiency"

Selected Answer: C
Answer is C. IntServ provides reserve bandwidth by using RSVP not DiffServ

choices.D: It provides reserve bandwidth by using RSVP.
choices.B: It guarantees end-to-end bandwidth for traffic.
